greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of compositions of n into k parts with distinct multiplicities, where parts are counted without multiplicities; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=max{i:A000292(i)<=n}, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, s) option remember; `if`(n=0, add(j, j=s)!,
`if`(i<1, 0, expand(add(`if`(j>0 and j in s, 0, `if`(j=0, 1, x)*
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n$2, {})):
mathematica: b[n_, i_, s_List] := b[n, i, s] = If[n == 0, Total[s]!, If[i<1, 0, Expand[ Sum[ If[j>0 && MemberQ[s, j], 0, If[j == 0, 1, x]*b[n-i*j, i-1, If[j == 0, s, s ~Union~ {j}]]/j!], {j, 0, n/i}]]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, n, {}]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 16}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 11 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A182485 (the same for partitions), A242887.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 25 2014
